results.title: Project for all seasons
results.creator_credit: Canadian International Development Agency and Jim White
results.brief_description: describes a project funded by Canada and the World Bank to aid agriculture, grazing and road building in Africa. The project also built an administration centre and a town of 85 houses. They helped to provide employment so that their menfolk working down mines in South Africa could return home.

results.title: Project expansion
results.creator_credit: Ross Wood Productions, Ross Wood and Robert Walker
results.brief_description: A major expansion program, begun by New Broken Hill Consolidated Ltd, in 1968, was completed in 1971. The film describes the expansion activities, which included the sinking of a three-thousand foot air shaft and major extensions to the underground workings. Many views of modern mining methods are provided. Could be used for geography, secondary social studies, and for general interest.

results.title: Project 500 Kv
results.brief_description: Tells the story of the stringing of high voltage cables across the Gippsland countryside. Working with electric line transmissions oat half a million volts is difficult work and both the testing of the apparatus and the building of the towers and lines provide many spectacular scenes.

results.title: Project 074
results.creator_credit: Peter De Normanville and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: The standard method of measuring engine wear is to weigh a piston ring before and after a long period of running. A far less laborious procedure makes use of a radio-active piston ring; radiating particles worn from the ring circulate in the lubricating oil, and their abundance, which can be accurately measured, gives a practically instantaneous indication of engine wear. All this is explained in this film, and views of the Harwell atomic pile are also shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter De Normanville and Shell Film Unit

results.title: Progressive waves: transverse & longitudinal
results.brief_description: Introduces the subject of transverse progressive waves by Illustrating a pulse being sent down a stretched rope. Shows its velocity of travel to be dependent upon the elastic and inertial factors. Employs a stretched string to show steady waves train propagation, and identifies and relates waves length and frequency. Longitudinal wave disturbance is shown by a pulse moving down a row of beads connected by light-weight strings.

results.title: Progress: the story of the Rootes Group
results.creator_credit: Edward W. Beckett and Cecil Musk
results.brief_description: Traces the history of the Rootes Group of factories, manufacturers of automobiles and aircraft. Shows the Rootes workshop 40 years ago; the use of mechanized equipment in WW1; amalgamation with the Humber organization; rationalization of the Rootes group resulting in decreased production costs and increased quality of products. The major part of the film illustrates the magnitude of the part played by the Rootes group in manufacturing armoured cars, trucks, bombers, and fighters during WW2.

results.title: Progress with precision
results.brief_description: Visits various industrial centres in England and shows how Capstan and Turret Lathes are made. All the elaborate components are examined, along with the finished machines.

results.title: Progress reported: the story of the Irish peat industry
results.creator_credit: Irish Tourist Board, Vincent Corcoran and Joe Mendoza
results.brief_description: An account of the growth of the Irish peat industry. Peat is now gathered by machinery and the industry provides employment for many people. The many uses of peat are explained - for heating, industry, and electricity.

results.title: Progress
results.brief_description:
This film gives a chronological account of the First Fleet’s arrival to Sydney Harbour bridge and it’s opening to the public; the construction of the Sydney Harbour Tunnel and it’s opening to the public.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Programming controlling producing
results.brief_description: Studies the Index factories in West Germany, and the machines they make. Their designs are shown, and the major components of their Automatic engines are examined.
